Reviews.Title: Good Product But...
Reviews.Author: Ryan F.
Reviews.Content: It shipped with a dead pixel and the plastic face has a noticeable scratch on it.  It is obvious that the unit was not handled with care.  Also, the sound quality is mediocre.  Luckily, I hook it up to my Logitech Speaker System Z623.On the bright side this TV came in the mail on time and has stood up to most of my expectations.  It has a bright LED display, 1 USB port, 3 HDMI ports, and a remote control.  I like the picture quality, and it easy to customize to personal preferences.  I mainly use this TV for watching HD movies and playing my XBOX 360 in 1080p.

Reviews.Title: Junk at any price: An insult to the Honeywell name.
Reviews.Author: Renaissance Man "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have commented about the sound quality and dead pixels on the screen right out of the box.  While I paid a discounted $149 just a couple of days before other purchasers were buying for $107, perhaps it's not surprising that Amazon no longer has the item in stock -- they were probably trying to quickly unload whatever inventory they had!Dead pixels (white dots on a black screen or black dots on a white screen) are caused by a defective or worn out DLP chip in the product.  Could Sonitronix Corporation be deliberately purchasing seconds or factory imperfect chips for this Avanza product line and rely upon their purchasing a license to use the premium Honeywell brand name to promote a third rate product?  The condition of pixels remaining stuck in a permanent on or off condition can and does occur after long term use (usually thousands of hours) and gradually continues to worsen once it has started.  Premium manufacturers such as Mitsubishi, Samsung and others typically provide a warranty repair or replacement of their units if two or more dead pixels occur at any time during the two-year warranty period and, by so doing, appear to be creating a voluntary industry standard.  Acer, on the other hand, has had significant problems with their flat screen computer monitors.As for the tinny sound quality, an insult to the ears might be a better description, sounding to me something like a screeching chimpanzee and a squawking parrot playing volleyball with a tin can full of rusty nails, nuts and bolts.  Honeywell Avanza offers the Honeywell Soundbar through their product manual (a minimum essential for most any flat screen television for tolerable listening) that would connect through the RCA outlet sockets on the unit side panel.  For even better audio quality one should be able to connect via the same outlet sockets to any other separate, quality speakers or sound system -- but not with this piece of junk.  The RCA outlets are totally inactive, not connected, whatever.I have been in communication with the Honeywell Consumer Electronics network (Sonitronix Corp.) by telephone for over two weeks, trying to politely reason with them but to no avail.  After all, nobody expects every item from a production line to be perfect.  After the obligatory time on hold for the next available representative, one always connects with the same person.  Perhaps there is only one person?  She's very polite and appears to be understanding but seems to have no authority to deal with problems.  Initially it was "I sympathize with your concerns but I'll have to refer the matter to my manager, Ryan, and then get back to you".  The following week it was "Ryan is no longer with the company.  I'll refer your situation to Aaron, who has taken over Ryan's caseload, and hopefully we can get back to you by the end of the week."True to her word, Misty did call and leave a voicemail on Friday afternoon, but the news was not good and calls into question the integrity of this pseudo-Honeywell/Sonitronix/Avanza entity.  Basically, the Honeywell Soundbar for attachment to the flat screen unit is a myth, a fabrication, a product of wishful thinking for some indeterminate future point in time.  No comment as to why the audio outlets do not work.  Moreover, Sonitronix denies all responsibility for pixel defects at any time, either when the product is brand new or at any future time during the "warranty" (joke?) period.  Would anyone accept a new computer with 4Gb Memory that only yields 3.77Gb, for example, or a 3.2GHz CPU that only performs at 2.93GHz?Bottom line, whatever one has been foolish enough to have purchased, they are stuck with as far as Sonitronix is concerned.  Kudos to Amazon, however, who have agreed to take this defective product back and issue a full refund.  I am currently awaiting the promised RMA by e-mail in order to send the product back.  My main regret is the huge amount of time wasted in trying to resolve the issue.  I hope this review provides a "buyer beware" warning to other potential purchasers and wish that Amazon would accept the "Zero Stars" rating that is deserved, in my opinion, rather than the forced single star.  I wonder whether Misty still has a job and for how long Sonitronics will remain in business.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: G. Long
Reviews.Content: I LOVE AMAZON.COM!  I bought this TV for $107 with free shipping and it arrived in 3 days.  How can you beat that?  It works great with a really nice picture.  Sound is just slightly "tinny".  This is still one fantastic deal; you may not be able to find it at the amazingly low price, but it would be a good buy at $160-180.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little TV
Reviews.Author: Old Guy
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a small guest room so grand kids had a tv to watch and use for video games. Just the right size for the room, very nice picture, decent sound and very easy set up. Three HDMI connections and other inputs for their games.Great price. I paid $130 and three days later was down to $113. Can't beat that. Time will tell how the product does long term.

Reviews.Title: Works PERFECTLY!
Reviews.Author: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
Reviews.Content: We love this HDTV.  It works perfectly, no dead pixels.  It's a 24" LED HDTV with  Full 1080P HD.  The sound is of decent quality, too.  This HDTV has 3 HDMI inputs, which is not as common on the smaller size HDTVs allowing for hookup of a game system, a blu-ray player and a Roku box without another device.This Honeywell HDTV was shipped to us as replacement for a different HDTV that developed a dead pixel line shortly after arrival. The warranty provider on the other HDTV explained all these HDTVs are sensitive to minor damage in shipping and can develop the pixel issue in the first few months of service due to the bumping during shipping.  We found it was very easy to contact the manufacturer and get a replacement unit shipped out. Kudos for great customer service! The box lists Sonitronix Corporation with a customer service number 888-907-1006.

Reviews.Title: Honeywell 24 inch Avanza TV/Combo
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I bought this Honeywell produce at Big Lots (should have known better) for a reasonable price.  When I opened the box, the bolts to attach the TV to the base was missing.  I tried calling "Sonitronix" at the 888 number listed in the warranty information, for five days, and waited until they hung up on me.  I then tried to leave a "priority" call back message, which was never returned and their website doesn't exist.  I think Sonitronix must be a scam company in Chino California.  I finally propped up the TV and it seems to work fine, except the speaker is horrible.  I have e-mailed Honeywell, Sonitronix, Tiger products, and finally Big Lots, and all have told me to call the fictitious Sonitronix.  Last time I'll buy a Honeywell product.

Reviews.Title: SUPER SAVING SHIPPING BEWARE!
Reviews.Author: E. White "~E"
Reviews.Content: This Tv is great for the price I paid, it was the cheapest one with full HD. The only 24" I could find with more than 1 HDMI port, it has 3, and all the ports you would find on the more expensive models.I read in the other reviews it had bad sound, and it is kind of dull sounding. The TV I switched from was 10 years old and had a more full sound. So I bought some $10 logitek USB Speakers and it sounds very nice now.SUPER SAVINGS?I had a large order, and they separated most things, and shipped them quickly, except for this TV and a Toshiba laptop I ordered... they took a full 2 weeks just to ship it... and when I got it, it was a large Amazon.com box that looked like hell, was falling apart, ripped, smashed corners, almost falling open. Opening it revealed the TV box, and the very much more smaller box my laptop was in, threwn in on top of the TV box, with no cushioning whatsoever, not even paper, or peanuts. The Toshiba box corners were all smashed as it had obviously been sliding around inside the giant Amazon.com box, on top the TV box...I can't understand for the life of me why they would ship these two items together the way they did. I almost returned the laptop for fear it might have been damaged on shipping, but talked to a customer service and they said I could try it for 30 days and if I felt it had been damaged they would exchange or refund, and so far, it's been ok. I'm actuallying typing from it now....But just the fact they would put the two together like that... beware...

Reviews.Title: Honeywell LE.24v206 24-inch
Reviews.Author: Antero
Reviews.Content: I had find this tv to be simply wonderful in so many waysi definably  like it thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Honeywell I love you!
Reviews.Author: Peter Salinas
Reviews.Content: I just received my Honeywell LE.24v206 24-inch LED-Lit TV, and OMG, this Honeywell is one honey of a deal.Had my computer hooked up to my 42 Vizio and the picture quality was not great, for a computer:O(But then I hooked my computer to this Honey, and man the picture quality is GREAT!Have not tested the sound quality, but than, I still have my computer sound system hooked up to my Vizio sound bar:O)

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Robert Reale
Reviews.Content: My son bought this with his christmas gift card collection. He mostly plays his xbox, he has been very happy. Good picture, limited features. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Joseph Lino
Reviews.Content: The TV was exactly what I was looking for. The price was great, what a surprise when I saw that and it all thefeatures I was looking for. The picture is sharp from almost any angle and the sound is also great for a smallTV. I wasn't pleased when I went to assemble the stand on the TV. The stand was broken and couldn't beattached. UNHAPPY with that. I would have given it five stars. I would recommend this TV  to others and have.I'm good at repairing things and was able to make stand work, infact it's better and stronger. Just a blessingfrom God.Joseph Lino

Reviews.Title: HONEYWELL SUCKS
Reviews.Author: DE MOOSE
Reviews.Content: DON'T BUY THIS TV WITH EXPECTATIONS OF A GOOD SET OF SPEAKERS... I AM DISAPPOINTED IN THE SOUND QUALITY BUT IT IS A GREAT TV OTHERWISE -- AFTER 6 MONTHS THE TUNER STARTED TO MALFUNCTION... I COULDN'T GET THROUGH TO HONEYWELL ON ANY LEVEL SO AMAZON TRIED TO REACH THEM AND COULD,'T EITHER SO AMAZON TOOK THE TV BACK AND ISSUED A REFUND... I SUPPOSE IT WOULD WORK WELL ON A CABLE SYSTEM, BUT ON MY LAVA ANTENNA THE TUNER WAS NOT VERY GOOD AND BECAME STEADILY WORSE..

Reviews.Title: Great item!
Reviews.Author: Kellie M. Flounders "kelvis66"
Reviews.Content: What a great TV for the price! Great picture as well and a 1080 TV. Would recommend this item for any room.

Reviews.Title: good tv, especially for the price
Reviews.Author: HollyM
Reviews.Content: tv is nice, good picture, sound is a little hollow sounding but for $100 bucks, who can beat it?  would recommend it if it's priced low...

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Victor E. Folk
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother-in-law to replace a smaller broken old TV in her bedroom.I was surprised at how nice the TV is and how clear the picture is, especially for an inexpensive TV using an only antenna.It doesn't have as many different inputs as my 55" Vizio, but I wouldn't expect it to for such a low price.If I had it to do all over again, i would definitely still buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: MTC "S.F. Bay Area"
Reviews.Content: Got it for $108 from Amazon on 12/30/2012. The next day it was $60 more! For what I paid, I am very happy. No bad pixels, all the standard bells and whistles, and a very nice picture. Perfect size for a small bedroom. The sound is a little "tinny", but that goes with the territory for this size.

ProductInfo.Features:
Full 1080p HDTV
50000:1 Dynamic Contract Ratio
LED Backlight
ProductInfo.Name: Honeywell LE.24v206 24-Inch LED-Lit 1080p 60Hz TV (Black)
